at the top of /boot/grub/menu.lst is a field that is default then a number... that number corresponds to the entry that will boot by default....   when you scroll to the bottom of menu.lst you will see 3+ menu entires that all loook very similar... select the one you want, count its position starting with 0 and place that number as the default number at the top of the file
